ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot of the german language, and culture. This class is a great continuation from last semester and you really do learn a lot of grammer and vocabulary..

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class is designed really well and has a lot of good assignments. The assignments can be weird and annoying at times, but overall they are good.

The workload, while overall manageable, was structured very strictly over the course of the week such that I often had to turn in assignments a day or so late. If due dates were organized by week rather than day, students would be afforded more flexibility in completing the same amount of homework but being able to fit it into their schedules.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this because it is so enjoyable and rewarding.

This class is a great way to get far in German in a short amount of time. My main complaint is that the workload, while not huge, is very regularly structured (something substantial due most weeknights) which resulted in a lot of late assignments and a lot of late nights on evenings when I had other commitments and planned to do other work on other nights. Overall, great course!
